tit.cmt: 第一段落で説明書きがあるため、定訳の説明書きは省きました。
tit.e: Kamigata Hanashika (traditional comic storyteller of the Kansai region)
tit.cmt: 統一リストに従い、括弧で補足を入れました。

sen.j: 上方噺家（かみがたはなしか）とは、上方落語を話す噺家（落語家）のこと。
sen.e: Kamigata hanashika is Hanashika (professional Rakugo storyteller) of Kamigata rakugo, traditional Japanese comic storytelling as performed in the Kyoto-Osaka region.
Kamigata hanashika is Hanashika (professional Rakugo storyteller) of Kamigata rakugo, traditional Japanese comic storytelling as performed in the Kyoto-Osaka region.
Kamigata hanashika is Hanashika (professional Rakugo storyteller) of Kamigata rakugo, traditional Japanese comic storytelling as performed in the Kyoto-Osaka region.

sen.j: 現存する上方噺家の亭号は、笑福亭、桂、林家、月亭、橘家、立花家、露（の）、森乃、（明石家）である。
sen.e: Existing stage names of Kamigata hanashika are Shofukutei, Katsura, Hayashiya, Tsukitei, Tachibanaya, Tuyu(no), Morino, (and Akashiya).
Existing stage names of Kamigata hanashika are Shofukutei, Katsura, Hayashiya, Tsukitei, Tachibanaya, Tuyu (no), Morino, (and Akashiya).
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。
sen.e: Existing stage names of Kamigata hanashika are Shofukutei, Katsura, Hayashiya, Tsukitei, Tachibanaya, Tuyu (no), Morino, (and Akashiya).

sen.j: かつては立川、三遊亭もあったが、前者は明治期に、後者は太平洋戦争後に断絶している。
sen.e: There used to be Tachikawa and Sanyutei, but the former extinguished in the Meiji era and the latter after the Pacific War.
There used to be Tachikawa and Sanyutei, but the former extinguished in the Meiji era and the latter after the Pacific War.
There used to be Tachikawa and Sanyutei, but the former extinguished in the Meiji era and the latter after the Pacific War.

sen.j: 現在では上方落語協会などを設立している。
sen.e: Today they establish Kamigata Rakugo Association.
Today they establish Kamigata Rakugo Association.
Today they establish Kamigata Rakugo Association.

sen.j: 笑福亭一門は、系譜的には大阪の松鶴一門と京都の福松一門とに分かれる。
sen.e: Shofukutei family can be genealogically divided into Shokaku family of Osaka and Fukumatsu family of Kyoto.
Shofukutei family can be genealogically divided into Shokaku family of Osaka and Fukumatsu family of Kyoto.
Shofukutei family can be genealogically divided into Shokaku family of Osaka and Fukumatsu family of Kyoto.

sen.j: 但し福松一門は、現在は亭号を「森乃」とし、定紋も「五枚笹」から「梟（ふくろう）」に改めている。
sen.e: Fukumatsu family, however, has changed its stage name to "Morino" and their Jomon (family crest) from "Gomaizasa (five bamboo grasses)" to "Owl".
Fukumatsu family, however, has changed its stage name to 'Morino' and their Jomon (family crest) from 'Gomaizasa' (five bamboo grasses) to 'Owl.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。括弧の位置、ピリオドの位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: Fukumatsu family, however, has changed its stage name to 'Morino' and their Jomon (family crest) from 'Gomaizasa' (five bamboo grasses) to 'Owl.'

sen.j: 露の一門は、系譜上は春団治一門の傍流とされる。
sen.e: Tsuyuno family is genealogically regarded as a branch of Harudanji family.
Tsuyuno family is genealogically regarded as a branch of Harudanji family.
Tsuyuno family is genealogically regarded as a branch of Harudanji family.

sen.j: これは二代目五郎兵衛が二代目桂春団治の弟子であるためである。
sen.e: This is because the second-generation Gorobe was a student of the second-generation Harudanji KATSURA.
This is because the second-generation Gorobe was a student of the second-generation Harudanji KATSURA.
This is because the second-generation Gorobe was a student of the second-generation Harudanji KATSURA.

sen.j: 上方の林家は元々江戸(東京)・林家から分立したものである。
sen.e: Hayashiya of Kamigata was originally separated from Hayashiya of Edo (Tokyo).
Hayashiya of Kamigata was originally separated from Hayashiya of Edo (Tokyo).
Hayashiya of Kamigata was originally separated from Hayashiya of Edo (Tokyo).

sen.j: 現在の上方林家は五代目笑福亭松喬が二代目林家染丸を襲名して再興したため、系譜上は笑福亭（松鶴一門）の傍流とされる。
sen.e: Kamigata Hayashiya of today is genealogically regarded as a branch of Shofukutei (Shokaku family), since the five-generation Shokyo SHOFUKUTEI succeeded the professional name of the second-generation Somemaru HAYASHIYA to reestablish the family.

Kamigata Hayashiya of today is genealogically regarded as a branch of Shofukutei (Shokaku family), since the five-generation Shokyo SHOFUKUTEI succeeded the professional name of the second-generation Somemaru HAYASHIYA to reestablish the family.

Kamigata Hayashiya of today is genealogically regarded as a branch of Shofukutei (Shokaku family), since the five-generation Shokyo SHOFUKUTEI succeeded the professional name of the second-generation Somemaru HAYASHIYA to reestablish the family.

sen.j: また、再興の経緯から、現在は「染丸」を、旧来の「林家正三」（しょうざ）に代わる一門の止め名としている。
sen.e: Because of this background of reestablishment, they have "Somemaru" as the family tomena (uninherite name) instead of original "Shoza HAYASHIYA".
sen.cmt: 訳語集に記載の"uninherite"はそのまま採用しましたが、辞書などで見当たらない単語です。たとえば"uninherited"のスペルミスではないでしょうか。
sen.e: Because of this background of reestablishment, they have 'Somemaru' as the family tomena (uninherite name) instead of original 'Shoza HAYASHIYA.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。括弧の位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: Because of this background of reestablishment, they have 'Somemaru' as the family tomena (uninherite name) instead of original 'Shoza HAYASHIYA.'

sen.j: 現在の上方林家は四代目染丸一門（三代目染語楼系統、四代目小染系統を含む）と三代目染三一門に分かれる。
sen.e: Today's Kamigata Hayashiya is divided into the fourth-generation Somemaru family (including the third-generation Somegoro group and the fourth-generation Kosome group) and the third-generation Somezo family.

Today's Kamigata Hayashiya is divided into the fourth-generation Somemaru family (including the third-generation Somegoro group and the fourth-generation Kosome group) and the third-generation Somezo family.

Today's Kamigata Hayashiya is divided into the fourth-generation Somemaru family (including the third-generation Somegoro group and the fourth-generation Kosome group) and the third-generation Somezo family.

sen.j: 前者は上方落語協会・吉本興業に所属するプロ落語家である。
sen.e: The former is a group of professional Rakugo storytellers belonging to Kamigata Rakugo Association and Yoshimoto Kogyo Co., Ltd.
The former is a group of professional Rakugo storytellers belonging to Kamigata Rakugo Association and Yoshimoto Kogyo Co., Ltd.
The former is a group of professional Rakugo storytellers belonging to Kamigata Rakugo Association and Yoshimoto Kogyo Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 一方、後者は染三が六代目松鶴との確執の末関西落語文芸協会を興し分離した物で、フリーまたはアマチュアの落語家が多い。
sen.e: On the other hand the latter was established as a result of clash between Somezo and the sixth-generation Shokaku and established Kansai Rakugo Literature Association, and includes freelance or amateur Rakugo storytellers

On the other hand the latter was established as a result of clash between Somezo and the sixth-generation Shokaku and established Kansai Rakugo Literature Association, and includes freelance or amateur Rakugo storytellers.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。
sen.e: On the other hand the latter was established as a result of clash between Somezo and the sixth-generation Shokaku and established Kansai Rakugo Literature Association, and includes freelance or amateur Rakugo storytellers.
